choices.C: Leverage a configuration group for all users in your top-level organization unit.
choices.A: Turn on the service and move the users to an organizational unit (OU) or access group.
choices.D: Dynamic groups for the business unit requiring the service needs to be enabled.
choices.B: Use Google Cloud Identify to manage users and access to required services.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I’m leaning toward A on this one.

questions.question_text: You are a ChromeOS Administrator in a large organization. You turned off a service for all users of the entire organization, however that same service is required for the users of one unit. How do you ensure that service is available to the users of that particular unit?

choices.C: When a replacement device is sent from an OEM to replace a defective device.
choices.B: When the device has been sitting in a warehouse for more than 90 days.
choices.A: When the device has been purchased from an authorized reseller.
choices.D: When the device has been signed in to by a user before enrolling it.
choices.E: When the device has been previously enrolled in a different domain.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I’m cool with A, unless someone’s got a better take.

questions.question_text: As the ChromeOS Administrator, you have been given previously used devices by another organization that have been used, but do now know the current management state of the devices. When are you required to wipe a device before enrolling it?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I'm vibing with C here.

choices.D: A list of specific users within the domain
choices.A: A set of organizational units to be managed
choices.B: A set of select privileges within the admin console
choices.C: A set of access control lists

questions.question_text: What is a custom admin role composed of?
Which two types of certificates can be used on ChromeOS devices? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Not super confident, but I’ll go with C.

questions.question_text: Your administration team is about to deploy a fleet of ChromeOS devices. Your users have their own peripherals and you would like them to use what they have if possible. You also would like to let your users know what peripherals work and what peripherals do not. What should you do for your users?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Kinda torn, but A looks most likely.

choices.D: Send them all new peripherals and have your users send in their old equipment even if the old equipment works.
choices.C: Create Change Management documentation that provides them with information on how to check their current peripherals and instruction on how to get new equipment.
choices.A: Tell your users that every peripheral works with ChromeOS.
choices.B: Tell your users to try what they have and to start an IT support ticket if something isn’t working right.
